title: How to Make Cheesy Pasta with Ham and Peas

steps.headline: Fill a big pan of water and add a good teaspoon of salt.
steps.description: Use less salt if you wish.

steps.headline: Bring it to boil on the stove or hob and add the pasta.
steps.description: Follow the instructions on a the packet to see how long you have to cook it for.

steps.headline: Add the crushed, chopped garlic to the mascarpone and milk and then stir.
steps.description: Do this while your pasta cooks.

steps.headline: Drain the pasta when it is cooked and stir it in the mascarpone mixture.
Cut the ham into pieces, using a knife and toss it all into the pasta with the cooked peas.
Stir in the chives, season with a little salt and pepper and serve at once.
steps.description: Crusty bread  and a simple green salad can be served as an accompaniment.

steps.headline: Improve this basic dish by adding your favourite herbs, using a really good quality baked or honey roasted ham and the best mascarpone cheese you can obtain.
steps.description: Fresh peas, lightly blanched will enhance this or, try frozen petit pois if you can't get fresh peas. Add a little white wine to the mascarpone mix or try ricotta cheese instead, or even cream cheese such as Philadelphia if you are trying to cut costs rather than make the dish more luxurious.

text: Fill a big pan of water and add a good teaspoon of salt. Use less salt if you wish. Bring it to boil on the stove or hob and add the pasta. Follow the instructions on a the packet to see how long you have to cook it for. Add the crushed, chopped garlic to the mascarpone and milk and then stir. Do this while your pasta cooks. Drain the pasta when it is cooked and stir it in the mascarpone mixture.  Cut the ham into pieces, using a knife and toss it all into the pasta with the cooked peas.  Stir in the chives, season with a little salt and pepper and serve at once. Crusty bread  and a simple green salad can be served as an accompaniment. Improve this basic dish by adding your favourite herbs, using a really good quality baked or honey roasted ham and the best mascarpone cheese you can obtain. Fresh peas, lightly blanched will enhance this or, try frozen petit pois if you can't get fresh peas. Add a little white wine to the mascarpone mix or try ricotta cheese instead, or even cream cheese such as Philadelphia if you are trying to cut costs rather than make the dish more luxurious.
